comments:
Description:
Exception when try to get display text from multi-select parameters
Build number:2.2.1.v20070827

Steps to reproduce:
1. New a report parameter p1, listbox.
2. Add values like
DisplayText/Value
v1/1
v2/2
v3/3
v4/4.
3. Insert a data item to Layout, Input expression as 
var values="";
for (i=0;i<params["p1"].displayText.length;i++)
values=values+params["p1"].displayText[i]+".";
values; 
4. Preview in Web Viewer and HTML.

Expected result:
Process the displayText properly without errors.

Actual result:
EngineException.

Error log:
The following items have errors:

ReportDesign (id = 1):
- Retrieving binding data error

Retrieving binding data error ( 2 time(s) )

 at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.document.util.ExprResultSet.getValue(ExprResultSet.java:130)

The displayText is not a array, it is a String. So the user shouldn't use 
params[n].displayText[i].

The issue is that when I preview in Layout, there are no Exceptions and it can display some content for displayText.
So reopen it for further research.

1. the viewer set the display text in the run and render task but doesn't set the display text in run task.

2. the user should detect if the displayText is NULL before call displayText.length.
Currently, we don't support display text of multi-value parameter. Viewer will set NULL value for it. Please check it.

causedBy.message: Invalid expression to retrieve value in presentation.
